Class PluginIntegration

java.lang.Object
de.dei0.blockprot.bukkit.integrations.PluginIntegration
Direct Known Subclasses:
LandsPluginIntegration, PlaceholderAPIIntegration, TownyIntegration, UltimateTeamsIntegration, WorldGuardIntegration
public abstract class PluginIntegration extends Object
A plugin integration that can register new event listeners and add functionality to bring compatibility with another Bukkit plugin. Integrations should be always registered and only its listeners and other functionality loaded in the enable() function when the dependent plugin is loaded.
Since:
0.4.0

  • Field Details

    • configuration

      @NotNull protected @NotNull org.bukkit.configuration.file.YamlConfiguration configuration
      The YamlConfiguration that backs this plugin integration. The name supplied in PluginIntegration(String) is used as the filename to read this configuration.
      Since:
      0.4.0

  • Method Details

    • filterFriends

      @CheckReturnValue @Deprecated @NotNull public static @NotNull ArrayList<org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer> filterFriends(@NotNull @NotNull ArrayList<org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer> friendsInput, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.block.Block block)
      Deprecated.
      This lets all registered plugin integrations filter out friends that they don't want players to add to block.This method will check filterFriendByUuid(UUID, Player, Block) and filterFriendsInternal(ArrayList, Player, Block) for backwards compatibility. Note that we also use reflection to determine which of these functions to call and therefore filterFriendByUuidForAll(UUID, Player, Block) might be a more performant option.
      Parameters:
      friendsInput - The initial (default) list of friends that can be added. This ArrayList is not modified within this function.
      player - The player that is trying to add these friends.
      block - The block these friends are being added to.
      Returns:
      The new filtered list.
      Since:
      0.4.0
      See Also:
      • filterFriendByUuidForAll(UUID, Player, Block)

    • filterFriendByUuidForAll

      public static boolean filterFriendByUuidForAll(@NotNull @NotNull UUID friend, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.block.Block block)
      This lets all registered plugin integrations filter out friends that they don't want players to add to block. This method will exclusively check filterFriendByUuid(UUID, Player, Block).
      Parameters:
      friend - The initial (default) list of friends that can be added. This ArrayList is not modified within this function.
      player - The player that is trying to add these friends.
      block - The block these friends are being added to.
      Returns:
      The new filtered list.
      Since:
      1.1.0

    • isEnabled

      public abstract boolean isEnabled()
      Checks whether or not this plugin integration is currently enabled.
      Returns:
      Boolean if this integration is enabled.
      Since:
      0.4.0

    • load

      public void load()
      Load and setup basic values for this plugin integration. No other plugins (including BlockProt) are enabled at this point.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • enable

      public abstract void enable()
      Load and setup this plugin integration. Should only be called once.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • reload

      public void reload()
      Called when the BlockProt plugin reloads configs and translations. Optimally, translations should be updated and new config values should be updated in this function.
      Since:
      1.0.7

    • getPlugin

      @Nullable public abstract @Nullable org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin getPlugin()
      Get the plugin this integration depends on. Can be null, if the dependency is not loaded.
      Returns:
      The plugin this integration depends on.
      Since:
      0.4.12

    • filterFriendsInternal

      @Deprecated protected void filterFriendsInternal(@NotNull @NotNull ArrayList<org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer> friends, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.block.Block block)
      Deprecated.
      An integration can freely override this function to change the friends that can be added for a block by player.
      Parameters:
      friends - The initial (default) list of friends that can be added.
      player - The player that is trying to add these friends.
      block - The block these friends are being added to.
      Since:
      0.4.0

    • filterFriendByUuid

      protected boolean filterFriendByUuid(@NotNull @NotNull UUID friend, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.block.Block block)
      An integration can freely override this function to filter which friends can be added to a block by player. In general, this function should be used together with Stream.filter(Predicate).
      Parameters:
      friend - The UUID of the player to be checked for as a friend.
      player - The player that is trying to add these friends.
      block - The block these friends are being added to.
      Returns:
      True if the friend is allowed to be added, false if it should be filtered out of the list.
      Since:
      1.1.0

    • registerListener

      protected void registerListener(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.event.Listener listener)
      Register any Bukkit event listener.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener we want to register.
      Since:
      0.4.0
